ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY_ADDITIONAL.OFFICIALNAME: Borkum Riffgrund I Offshore Windpark A/S GmbH & Co. oHG
Borkum Riffgrund 2 Offshore Wind Farm GmbH & Co. oHG
Gode Wind 1 Offshore Wind Farm GmbH & Co. oHG
Gode Wind 2 Offshore Wind Farm P/S GmbH & Co. oHG

TITLE.P: Tender for German Legal Services to Ørsted

SHORT_DESCR.P: Ørsted Services A/S and the companies mentioned in Tender Annex A of the Tender Conditions, are hereby inviting you to tender for German Legal Services to Ørsted.
The contracting entity is tendering for a framework agreement (“Framework Agreement”) covering German legal services.
• Lot 1: Full service except for areas of law covered by lot no. 2-3
• Lot 2: Regulatory advice within offshore wind
• Lot 3: Employment and Labour Law
The Contracting Entity intends to award two (2) suppliers the Framework Agreement for Lot 1, Lot 2 and award one (1) supplier for Lot 3.
The tenderer can bid for one or more lots.
The Framework Agreements will feature a duration of two (2) years, plus two (2) options to extend for one (1) year.

TITLE.P: Lot 1: Full service except for areas of law covered by lot no. 2 - 3

SHORT_DESCR.P: This lot covers all services not covered by lot no. 2 to 3, including, but not limited to the following areas of law; corporate Law, banking and finance; capital markets; construction law; real estate; antitrust/competition law (incl. state aid);

disputes and litigation; energy law; financial regulation; GDPR; commercial contracts including contracts for sale and purchase of power and gas; corporate power purchase agreements; Anti-bribery and sanctions and M&A.

It is a minimum requirement for participation that the tenderer employs 200 lawyers as of 1 March 2022, (in German: Rechtsanwälte/Rechtsanwältinnen) who are registered at the Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer)
The contracting entity intends to award two (2) suppliers with a Framework Agreement under this Lot, cf. section 8 for call offs under the agreements.

INFO_ADD.P: Options 2 x 12 months extension.

The tender is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III. 1.4 may submit a tender. The estimated total maximum value for this lot is 15-20 MEUR

TITLE.P: Lot 2 Regulatory advice within offshore wind.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 2: Regulatory advice within offshore wind.
This lot covers specialist regulatory advice within offshore wind, including, but limited to:
o All German and EU offshore wind-relevant energy laws, regulations, and policies relevant to offshore wind, including the German Renewable Energy Act (EEG) and the Offshore Wind Act (WindseeG).

o Laws in Germany and in EU applicable to offshore wind, including those related to the transmission of electricity and functioning of the electricity market (e.g., the Energy Industry Act – EnWG), and the relevant regulators in the German market such as the Bundesamt für Seeschifffahrt und Hydrographie and the Bundesnetzagentur.
o German, European and international maritime laws as well as German environmental and planning laws, as applicable to offshore wind farms, respectively.

o Public law as it applies to offshore wind and the ability to suggest/manage claims, including the appropriate legal remedies against relevant regulators such as the Bundesamt für Seeschifffahrt und Hydrographie, the Bundesnetzagentur and transmission system operators.

It is a minimum requirement for participation that the tenderer employs 10 lawyers as of 1 March 2022, (in German: Rechtsanwälte/Rechtsanwältinnen) who are registered at the Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer).
The contracting entity intends to award two (2) suppliers with a Framework Agreement under this Lot 2, cf. section 8 for call offs under the Framework Agreements.

INFO_ADD.P: Options 2 x 12 months extension.

The tender is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III. 1.4 may submit a tender. The estimated total maximum value for this lot is 2,5 - 4 MEUR

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 3: Employment and Labour Law
This lot covers specialist within employment and labour law advice, but not limited to, advice on:
o This lot covers specialist employment and labour law advice, including, but not limited to, advice on:
o Works council negotiations/agreements and advice in works constitution law (“Betriebsverfassungsrecht”);
o Employment contracts and working hours in the offshore sector;
o Lines of command, responsibilities, and liability within matrix organisations;
o Local governance vis-a-vis centralised decision-making processes in multi-national companies;
o Employment-related disputes and settlements;
o GDPR related to employments;
o Income tax law;
o Social security law including corporate pension systems/company pension/partial retirement;
o Lease of employees and alternative legal structures and solutions.
The Tenderer should note that there will often be physical meetings, negotiations and court hearings in Hamburg and Norddeich.

It is a minimum requirement for participation that the tenderer employs 30 lawyers and at least 5 lawyers who are specialized within employment and labour law as of 1 March 2022, (in German: Rechtsanwälte/Rechtsanwältinnen) who are registered at the Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer)
The contracting entity intends to award one (1) supplier with a Framework Agreement under this Lot 3, cf. section 8 for call offs under the Framework Agreements.

INFO_ADD.P: Options 2 x 12 months extension.

The tender is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III. 1.4 may submit a tender. The estimated total maximum value for this lot is 1-1,5 MEUR

RULES_CRITERIA.P: • Lot 1: It is a minimum requirement for participation that the Tenderer employs 200 lawyers as of 1 March 2022, (in German: Rechtsanwälte/Rechtsanwältinnen) who are registered at the Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer).

• Lot 2: It is a minimum requirement for participation that the Tenderer employs 10 lawyers as of 1 March 2022, (in German: Rechtsanwälte/Rechtsanwältinnen) who are registered at the Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer).

• Lot 3: It is a minimum requirement for participation that the Tenderer employs 30 lawyers and at least 5 lawyers who are specialized within employment and labour law as of 1 March 2022, (in German: Rechtsanwälte/Rechtsanwältinnen) who are registered at the Bar Association (Rechtsanwaltskammer).

It is a minimum requirement for participation that a majority of the Tenderer’s employees carrying out the tasks covered by scope, are fluent in the English and German language and have passed the bar examination set by the (in German:

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: The Framework Agreement will be awarded to the most economically advantageous tender and identified based on the best price-quality ratio

INFO_ADD.P: The estimated yearly spend is based on among other things historical data and our expectations to the future. The estimated total amount is indicative with the maximum spend stated under each lot. See section 26.2 in the Framework Agreement.
Applicants in a consortium will be jointly and severally liable to the contracting entity for the fulfilment of the contract.
Guide on how to get access to tender material:
• Register on www.orstedprocurement.com under “Register Here” if you have not already done so
• Log-in to Jaggaer
• Click on “My RFIs”
• Click “RFI Open to All Suppliers”

• Click on the arrow in the search bar and choose if you want to search for RFI Description or Project Code. In the drop-down list, choose “Contains” and search in the blank field next to it and click “Search”. You can search for: rfp_934 – Tender for German Legal Services
• Click on the RFI
• Click ”Express Interest” and click “OK” to the pop-up messages
• The RFI is now moved over to “My RFI’s” and you can see the tender materials and create a response under “My Response” “material”
• Uploaded information will be available to the Contracting Entity once you have pressed “Submit Response” in Ørsted’s Procurement Portal.
• Once the set Tender Deadline has expired, you will not be able to change or re-submit any documents unless at the request of the Contacting Entity.

• The maximum size of individual files is 50 MB. You should look into whether it is possible to zip files which exceed the individual maximum of 50 MB. It is possible to submit multiple zipped files with a maximum size of 200 MB each.
• You are encouraged to test the system in good time before the Tender Deadline and contact the Contracting Entity via Ørsted’s Procurement Portal if you experience technical difficulties.
